reviews.text: A group of travelers, we stayed in this hotel for one night. Several problems arose, and were not dealt with satisfactorily.
reviews.title: Not a wonderful experience..

reviews.text: - Upon arrival, several people were assigned to a room which contained no bed..! The rooms were also not tidy, but the main issue was that there were no beds - just empty space. As we enquired about this, we were told that the rooms were previously used for staff meetings. Beds could be brought back in, but this would take apparently hours. As it was evening, I asked for our group members to be assigned to new rooms, and only after much discussion and "convincing" did the hotel staff agree to assign us the new rooms, so that people could relax in their rooms.
reviews.title: Accommodation (& Accommodating!)

reviews.text: - We booked a table in the "68 Clooney Restaurant" for dinner, and arrived in at agreed time. After sitting there over 30 minutes no member of staff had approached us. Then one did, abruptly telling us that "we must understand that the restaurant is dead busy now" (which was amusing, as it was more than half empty!), and "we'd need to wait at least 30 minutes more before orders could be taken". Fab. Asking sarcastically what's the choice we have (as the hotel is in the middle of nowhere, and there are no other restaurants anywhere near), she looked at us and said "well, you can always leave". Grand service. Only after some bitter discussions, we were awarded a few bottles of wine complimentary while we awaited - hungry.
reviews.title: Worth a stay

reviews.text: - After well over an hour we got our orders in. I ordered "surf & turf in the hotel restaurant, and this menu item states it consists of: 4oz Fillet Steak, Pan Fried Scallops & Prawns in Garlic Butter, Battered Squid Rings & Wild Mushrooms. The steak was well overdone, the sauce cold, and the squid rings were magically transformed into ONION RINGS.
reviews.title: 1st class hotel

reviews.text: - Some of our group members went to sleep finally, only to encounter new issues...The new rooms which we managed to get after much fuss had been doublebooked - staff had given them to other (biker) guests, who came in with their keys, and promptly started to throw out the luggage of our group members. The situation escalated, with no help from the hotel. The elderly couple who's room was in main jeopardy was at risk of physical danger due to the hotel's apparent inability to manage their rooms.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: My partner booked for us to stay 2 nights in the hotel.. Rooms were spotless and beautiful made up.. Bathroom slightly small staff lovely and friendy very helpful and manger very nice person.. Only downfall was the banging and slamming of doors and drawers from the rooms on either side.. People coming in at 5am in the morning banging up the corridor after being awake from 5am the first night and 3am the 2nd It wasn't much of a sleep.. Beds not the most comfortable.. Back is broke ;( otherwise great food great staff and nice presented hotel
reviews.title: Ok stay :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was great when the bus pulled into Foyle Street on Friday....a couple of pints in the Gainsborough then Seamus the taxi out to my favourite hotel. Was good to see Keith when we checked in (maybe getting a little respite from the nappies)....a qick spray of the smellies and down to the bar where we quickly became reacquainted with Emmet. A pint later and off to 68 Clooney.....hank marvin I may add but not for long.....garlic mushrooms as an appetiser and peppered chicken for us both with a glass of wime all for a total of £29.99....Its called Tea for 2 for you and me. Highly recommended. The young waiter who delivered the "eating irons" wore a white glove to do so. Wondered if it was a scene from "phantom of the opera" but no the hotel is now 4 star.....and it shows. Back to the bar to be entertained by Niall....great singer, great atmosphere in the bar...if you get a chance to hear this guy take it. And Fiona on Saturday night what a voice...so good were going back on 30th to listen to her again..going again on 27th too as a treat for Alfie before he goes back to school cos he loves the "hotel with the fizzy water" ill need the speedos on that occasion. Anyway the staff her from the manager down cannot do enough for you. Its like a family re union without all the grief!!! Maybe thats why I go so often. Dill ALWAYS looks after me, and unfortunately Heidi was hiding. Thanks to all who made our anniversary so great. Roll on 27th........
reviews.title: a home from home

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights after our cycling tour of Ireland. Check in was very efficient. Our room was excellent. Food was extremely good, and a good menu choice. The hotel was very busy, but nothing was too much trouble for the staff, extremely friendly and efficient. excellent value for money.
reviews.title: Cycling tour

description: Combining warmth and elegance with modern facilities, the White Horse Hotel is the ideal venue whether you travel for business or for pleasure. This 4 Star BEST WESTERN PLUS property is located on the main route from Derry-Londonderry to the famous Giants Causeway This ensures our guests are perfectly positioned to experience both the vibrancy of the historic Walled City and the stunning natural beauty of the North Coast. We are the most closely located hotel for the City of Derry Airport which is just 1km away.With just fifty-eight guest bedrooms we place an emphasis on personal service & a friendly attention to detail. Our hotel facilities include a Bar, Restaurant, Leisure center (with pool steam room,sauna and extensive gym) and beauty salon.
